6.text: When I was 18, politics seemed boring. I didn't go and vote,

10.text:
I didn't pay attention. I didn't really
care at what age people got their pension,

14.text:
I was just starting out. I really had no
interest in what politics was about

18.text:
but I should have. The young are most
affected. Most 18 to 24's don't care

23.text: who gets elected, and I'm not surprised

24.text:
I once felt that way too. Why vote for a
system that doesn't represent you?

28.text:
Middle-aged, middle-classed. old men in
old buildings. Too posh and too rich to care

33.text: From the same schools and clubs, to same suits and same tailors

36.text: to the same privileged upbringings with no experience of failures.

40.text: When we see them answer questions,

41.text: a chance they should be seizing, they forget about us and resort to playground

44.text:
teasing, like children, taking part in a
food fight

47.text: wasting words that have power on a false appetite that lies. That only wants first prize.

51.text: That cares less about it's people, and more what power buys.

56.text:
But the government works for you, and
this can all be resolved,

59.text: if you stand up for what you believe in,

60.text: and do your part to get involved. There is strength in your numbers. You are not the minority.

63.text: You only feel this way as you've been made a low priority by politicians who are chasing the vote,

68.text:
They won't try and please you if they think
there's no hope. So prove them all wrong.

71.text: Prove you have a voice. Do the unexpected and accept you have a choice

74.text:
and vote! But first find out the truth.
Look at their policies,

77.text: and how they affect the youth. This world is yours to inherit. it's more your future then theirs.

83.text:
Don't let your life be dictated by the
old and billionaires.

86.text: It's the young that pay tuition.

88.text: It's the young that fight the wars.

89.text: it's the young who need jobs or could end up living outdoors.

92.text: It's the young who adopt the planet. it's the young who clean up the mess.

95.text: It's the young that care for the old. So why do the young vote less?

100.text:
You have a say, that needs to be
respected. People are dying for the right

103.text: to have a leader that's elected.

104.text:
So register to vote, be a part of
democracy. Doing nothing and complaining

110.text: You don't have to be a whisper, your voice's are real. You can be the generation

114.text: that gets a better deal. If you want to make a difference, you have to grow up.

118.text: Our country's fate is decided by those who show up.
